page.title: 03Bromley Development Plans
page.content:
The first of many plans for developing Bromley town centre was proposed in the 1950s. None were implemented, but the new M25 motorway, which will be completed in 1986, will have a large effect on Bromley, making more people and businesses want to come to Bromley, so a new plan has been proposed.
By making it easier for people to travel into central Bromley, the Borough Council hope that any new development will be in the town centre, and not in the surrounding areas.
At the moment, about 6% of Bromley's working age population is unemployed. Bromley Council hopes to provide opportunities for new shops and business to create more jobs. A plan for a new shopping centre should also help with this.
